content: What is the capital of France?
The capital of France is Paris. It's a beautiful city known for the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre Museum, and its rich history.
When was the Eiffel Tower built?
The Eiffel Tower was built in 1889 for the World's Fair (Exposition Universelle) held in Paris to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the French Revolution.
The Eiffel Tower is approximately 330 meters (1,083 feet) tall, including its antennas. Without the antennas, it stands at about 300 meters (984 feet).

The Eiffel Tower was designed by the French engineer Gustave Eiffel and his company. The design was actually created by Maurice Koechlin and Ã‰mile Nouguier, two senior engineers working for Eiffel's company, along with architect Stephen Sauvestre.
Is it the tallest structure in Paris?

Yes, the Eiffel Tower remains the tallest structure in Paris. It held the title of the world's tallest man-made structure for 41 years until the Chrysler Building was completed in New York City in 1930.

Yes, visitors can access the top of the Eiffel Tower. There are three levels open to the public. You can reach the first and second levels by stairs or elevator, and the third level (the summit) is accessible only by elevator. The views from the top are spectacular!
How many people visit it each year?

The Eiffel Tower receives approximately 7 million visitors per year, making it one of the most visited paid monuments in the world. During peak tourist season, it can receive up to 20,000 visitors per day.
What's special about its lighting at night?

The Eiffel Tower features a beautiful light show at night. It's illuminated by golden lights from sunset until 1 AM. Additionally, it sparkles for 5 minutes every hour on the hour with 20,000 twinkling lights. This sparkle show is one of Paris's most magical sights!
